definition[0]: a foul smell or taste is very unpleasant
example[0]: He woke up with a foul taste in his mouth.
example[2]: He put down his mug of foul-tasting coffee.
example[3]: Refugees in the camps are short of food and at risk from foul water.
example[4]: extractor fans to remove foul air from the tunnel
definition[2]: foul weather is stormy and windy, with a lot of rain or snow
example[5]: Always carry foul weather gear when you go out walking.
definition[3]: if a sports player fouls another player, they do something that is not allowed by the rules
definition[4]: to hit a ball outside the limit of the playing area in baseball
definition[5]: to make something very dirty, especially with waste
example[6]: rivers and lakes fouled almost beyond recovery by pollutants
definition[6]: an action in a sport that is against the rules
example[7]: Wright was booked for a foul on the goalkeeper.
definition[7]: a hit in baseball which goes outside the limits of the playing area
